questions.question: The primary objective of an aviation safety investigation into an aircraft accident or aircraft incident is to

answers.2: determine the adequacy of insurance regulations

questions.question: Details on civil aviation accident reporting procedures can be found in the
references: TC AIM-GEN - Reporting an Aviation Occurrence

questions.question: When an aircraft accident occurs, the pilot or operator of the aircraft involved shall ensure that the particulars of the accident are reported to the TSB

answers.4: as soon as possible and by the quickest means available.

questions.question: The TSB shall be notified of a reportable aviation accident when

answers.1: a person sustains serious or fatal injury as a result of being in or coming into direct contact with any part of an aircraft.
answers.2: an aircraft sustains damage or structural failure adversely affecting performance or flight characteristics and requiring major repair or replacement.
answers.3: an aircraft is missing or completely inaccessible.
answers.4: any of the above conditions exist.

questions.question: The TSB considers missing aircraft to be

answers.2: an occurrence which need not be reported.
answers.3: an aviation incident which need not be reported.
